title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest discusses how he inherited the No. 55 jersey tradition from Junior Seau at USC.
McGinest wore No. 55 during his Patriots career, becoming the team's second all-time sack leader.
Junior Seau joined the Patriots in 2006 and continued the No. 55 jersey tradition with McGinest's blessing.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County saw the heaviest snowfall in Massachusetts, with Salisbury and Beverly each receiving 13 inches on February 7, 2026.
Bristol County experienced snow totals up to 8.2 inches at 2 ESE Dartmouth, reported in the afternoon by public observers.
Norfolk County recorded a maximum of 5.5 inches in Weymouth by a trained spotter, with other towns reporting between 0.5 to 5.1 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC during the Patriots vs. Seahawks matchup at Super Bowl LX.
Tirico will also host NBC's Olympic studio program 'Primetime in Milan' following the Super Bowl broadcast.
Tirico has called major events like Olympics, Kentucky Derby, US Open, and recently added NBA play-by-play duties.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seattle Seahawks for Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
Quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest to win a Super Bowl, following his runner-up MVP finish in the regular season.
The Seahawks lead the league in scoring defense, which historically challenges All-Pro quarterbacks in Super Bowls, posing a test for Maye.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' head coach Mike Vrabel sought advice from Bill Belichick and Andy Reid before Super Bowl LX.
Vrabel discussed strategies with offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels ahead of coaching against the Seattle Seahawks.
The Patriots implemented a 14-minute simulated halftime, a method used by both Belichick and Reid in past Super Bowls.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots seek NFL record with seventh Super Bowl win, breaking tie with Pittsburgh Steelers.
Drake Maye could join elite group by winning Super Bowl in his second season.
Mike Vrabel aims to be first to win Super Bowl as both player and coach with same franchise.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs seeks to strengthen his Hall of Fame case with a potential Super Bowl LX win.
Diggs, 32, has 11,504 receiving yards and 73 touchdowns, aiming for top 15 in both categories.
Only two wide receivers who won Super Bowl MVP are Hall of Famers, adding complexity to Diggs's goal.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame as part of the 2026 class.
Vinatieri's crucial kicks helped the Patriots win three Super Bowls, including a game-winning kick in Super Bowl XXXVI.
Vinatieri scored an NFL record 2,673 points in his 24-season career, with 10 seasons on the Patriots.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel simulated a long halftime break during Patriots' final practice at Stanford Stadium for Super Bowl preparation.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye fully participated despite a prior shoulder issue; Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited.
Patriots practiced customary Friday routines with assistant coaches' drills and had player performances in final scrimmage sessions.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Drake Maye and Sam Darnold lead Patriots and Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, both former No. 3 overall picks.
Sam Darnold excelled in NFC Championship without turnovers; Drake Maye has struggled with turnovers in postseason.
Defensive performances from Milton Williams and Jaxon Smith-Njigba critical for Patriots and Seahawks matchup.
